intro: Mitscherlichia, commonly known as the "spider flower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often violet or purple flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing small, dry seeds. Mitscherlichia species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display.
